In Granada, explore the Alhambra Palace's water gardens with a Local Expert. Wander through Seville’s whitewashed alleys, then enjoy a private flamenco performance in an 18th-century mansion. In Lisbon, uncover royal tales at the elegant Queluz Palace. Experience a moving Cante Alentejano recital in Serpa, a form of traditional Portuguese singing recognised by UNESCO showcasing Portugal’s soulful heritage. In Madrid, an art historian will guide you through the Prado Museum’s Spanish masterpieces. Savour Iberia with curated culinary experiences, from Michelin-starred dining and market tastings to a hands-on cooking class, blending tradition with modern flair. Upon arrival, enjoy exquisite city views from the rooftop bar and infinity pool before dining on traditional Spanish delights. Day 2 - Catalonia’s Creative Capital Relaxed Start Wind your way along Barcelona's grand boulevards, taking in the city's elegant architecture and vibrant atmosphere, before visiting Gaudí's breathtaking Sagrada Família, a masterpiece of intricate design and soaring towers. Later, stroll through the colourful mosaics and playful designs of Park Güell with a Local Expert, uncovering Gaudí’s unique vision. Day 3 - Valencia and the Orange Blossom Coast Follow the golden Costa Dorada through olive and orange groves along the Mediterranean coast to seaside La Galera. Savour a creative Mediterranean menu made from fresh seasonal produce at Vicent Guimera's Michelin-starred L’Antic Molí before arriving in Valencia. Explore this vibrant city, rich in history with your Travel Concierge. Day 4 - Granada and the Alhambra Palace Discover Granada’s 13th-century Alhambra Palace, with its intricate Islamic designs, exotic gardens and tranquil pools. Conclude with a decadent stay at a renovated 19th-century palace. Day 5 - Córdoba and Seville Relaxed Start Step back in time at Córdoba’s Old Roman Bridge and great Mosque-Cathedral, strolling beneath delicate arches and pillars. Arriving in Seville, enjoy a cocktail before dining at an elegant restaurant. Day 6 - Seville, the City of Carmen Relaxed Start Discover the rich Andalusian culture of Seville, from its orange-scented streets to lively plazas. Personalise Your Day with a visit to the Fine Arts Museum to admire treasured masterpieces or explore the magnificent Seville Cathedral. Later, embrace the spirit of flamenco on a MAKE TRAVEL MATTER® Experience with a private dance lesson at the Cristina Heeren Foundation. Day 7 - The Flavours of Andalucía Relaxed Start After a Relaxed Start, immerse yourself in the sights, sounds and scents of Andalusia with a morning market visit to Mercado de Abastos. Your cooking experience awaits. Learn the secrets to Spain's popular dishes and dine on your creations. Day 8 - Serpa Lunch with Local Singing Perfomance Relaxed Start Greet Portugal in the charming hilltop town of Serpa. Over lunch, you're treated to a stirring performance of Cante Alentejano, a traditional polyphonic singing style recognised by UNESCO as Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity. This encounter is a MAKE TRAVEL MATTER® Experience, preserving an art form deeply woven into Alentejo’s cultural identity. Day 9 - Lisbon and the Age of Discoveries Relaxed Start Enjoy another Relaxed Start before viewing Lisbon’s Monument to the Discoveries and the Belém Tower. Continue with a visit to the National Coach Museum before marvelling at the architectural detail of the Queluz Palace. Finish the day enjoying local specialities as you dine in style this evening. Day 10 - Forever Évora Relaxed Start Bask in Évora’s flavours at Herdade da Calada winery where you’ll explore the estate, learn about their winemaking process and have the privilege to sip on a selection of their tantalising local wines well-known to the Portuguese but largely undiscovered further afield. Discover the charming, historic town of Evora', a UNESCO World Heritage site. Tonight, enjoy a delicious dinner of Alentejo specialities. Day 11 - The Roman Ruins of Mérida and Madrid Make your way across green and golden farmlands to Mérida’s well-preserved Roman Theatre. From Roman ruins to a vibrant, modern city, journey through the sunbaked landscapes of Extremadura to Madrid. As the city lights up, the evening is yours to stroll along Calle Serrano, Madrid’s most famous and elegant shopping street. Day 12 - Madrid of the Bourbons Relaxed Start Begin with a stroll among the city's historic sites with your Local Expert admiring the statue of Cervantes and the Cibeles Fountain that exhibits a rush of movement leaving you eager for sites to come. Personalise your day joining an art historian at the Prado Museum, or, explore the maze-like old town. Celebrate your travels over a final decadent dinner. Day 13 - Depart Madrid After breakfast, bid farewell to your travel companions before your private transfer to Madrid Barajas Airport.
